column5: I have always taken 631 thru Hornepayne. But Google Maos will tell you to take 614. So I tried that last June on the way home. Because it seemed like a good idea at the time. It wasn't.
That is incredibly helpful. Thanks! We always go through Hornepayne too and were considering 614. I'm glad I asked.

We took 614 on my first trip some years ago. As I remember it was kind of a neat route if you are in no hurry and if it was legal to enjoy a few Kokanees on the way, but, as already mentioned it is very rough...I think we traveled anywhere from 5-40 mph, mostly on the way lower end and not legal for the Kokanees! I had heard it was hit or miss on conditions of road but it is hard for me to believe they are ever pristine! Ever since it's been Hornepayne.
631 all the way. It is a lovely, scenic drive from White River to HWY 11. It's my favorite leg of the trip from Wawa to Nakina.
I don't know if that was a typo but I love it!
You will be fine but check their F/B page as the above mentioned photo's are old, still ice/no planes and bring your hip waders.

Definitely take 631. They repaved the culverts a few years ago and the road was fine last year. Just twisty/turny for anyone trying to sleep.Restroom stop at Wawa, food and gas at White River, then a jog up to Hornepayne and onto the pull-off at 11. West on 11 for the next leg and about 1hr 45min to Longlac.
Curious if Cordingly Lake's ice has gone out? We depart for our fly-in in 23 days.
23 days you'll be in like flint.
Most of the ice is off Cordingley. Yesterday Leuenberger's posted photos of one of their planes on floats at their dock and then video of the plane flying overhead.
We leave in 2 weeks and I have no worries. Nakina is in the 50, 60, and 70's the next two weeks. All lakes Leuenberger's fly to will be open by next weekend.
Speaking of Nakina, for those guys who drive up through the Sault, do you prefer: Taking 614 through Manitouwadge or Taking 631 through Hornepayne

i was going to take 17 over to 11 and go that way this summer. But i will always welcome suggestions or advice from others.... but first i've got to shepherd 3 newbies on train in trip at end of July. Will be fun tho.
631 is a nice paved road. No problem for any vehicle or trailer.
thanks.... maybe i need to reconsider and go up that way to 11. seems to be shorter...
I took 614 once and the industrial road was not worth the effort. It was gravel if you can call softball sized rocks gravel.
